Reviews.Title: “Fun and arty in the middle of everything... Salvador Dali meets Burning Man...”
Reviews.Author: mdeezine
Reviews.Content: First of all, don't believe the posted prices on their website or other online sources... I emailed the hotel directly and the prices were dropped by a over a third! And this was February, not exactly low season... So overall a really fun place, unusual brightly-colored art throughout (a lamp made from Ken & Barbie dolls!!) and a lovely tile staircase to our top floor apt. (the room we stayed in was actually called the 5th street apartment) Room was almost as fun and colorful as the lobby, very large for a hotel room, not brand-spanking new but clean. Bed was a bit hard but we actually slept really well. Was a kitchen area as well that we did not use but looked decent enough. Large bathroom with tiled walk in shower. Safes in the room were nice to have, everyone there was friendly but you never know... They also let us keep our bags in their lobby after checking out as we were taking a late night bus. (valuables were kept in locking pockets of course) It is quite noisy though, (I did end up using my earplugs) so that was a downside. Definitely makes you feel like you are part of the boisterous atmosphere of Playa del Carmen which is what's it all about there anyway! Still would definitely recommend to appreciators of unusual art or anyone looking for something a bit different then the resort-y, Americanized hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy rooms where I felt unsafe as a woman travelling alone”
Reviews.Author: Cjlaura
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in a good place however I found it overpriced, the bathroom was rusted where there was metal and my room was so loud at night I couldn't get to sleep until 3am. In addition I didn't feel safe there as a woman on my own

Reviews.Title: “quirky fun placce”
Reviews.Author: elle L
Reviews.Content: interestingly designed hotel unlike anything ive seen rooms were great staff fantastic steps from the beach nice boutique style room

Reviews.Title: “Best memories!”
Reviews.Author: AivaDingau
Reviews.Content: Bohemian oasis.. The hotel was incredibly beautiful and cosy. We really loved it, everything was nice and clean. We felt like at home, lovely balcony we spent a lot of time in there at nights. Main street rush, mariachi we miss it.. Staff extremely friendly and ready to help. Amazing beach was so close to the hotel. You don't need nothing else. We definetly woud like to come back, again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in heart of Playa”
Reviews.Author: DC-Dad
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel in the heart of Playa del Carmen, no faraway gated and self-contained resort, but somewhere we could walk and see the town and go to restaurants, beach, etc. This hotel is perfectly situated! It is absolutely beautiful, with Mexican tiles and green plants everywhere. There is a nice pool in the courtyard. The free wi-fi works great there, but it does not work in the rooms on the upper floors. Also, there is no elevator, so this hotel is only for those who don't mind stairs, including when carrying luggage or dive equipment. The air-conditioner in my room broke the first day, but they gave me an identical room one floor up. The place is clean, which is important. It is within 1/4 block of both the Thrifty Car Rental (much better than Avis) and Dive Mike, the best dive shop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: SydneySoulDancer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quirky in its decor and clean. It is centrally located being right on the plaza. The rooms are clean and several different types to choose from. We were made to feel very welcome from the start and enjoyed our stay very much whilst in Playa del Carmen. Thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “This place was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: sofacitysweethearts
Reviews.Content: We had booked another hotel online and stayed there on the first night of our trip. We flew into Cancun (to save $$$), and were traveling by bus to Belize. We met some people who were staying at Jungla Caribe, and they showed us their room. We were amazed that we spent more to stay farther away from the beaches and in a place that wasn't nearly as nice. We canceled our reservation for our last night and stayed here instead. $36 USD for a beautiful room with a balcony (with a Caribbean view). I still can't believe it. Everything was perfect about this place. It is on the main pedestrian street (near the bus station/beach/Cozumel ferry, everything). We will be staying here again..definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Your Search is Over”
Reviews.Author: canadianquarter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful spot on the main street (no cars allowed on the street) where people wonder around at all the lovely shops and sites.. with its true Mexcian flavor. Only two minutes to the beach. The rooms are very spacious and most comfortable with all that one would need. The wonderful creative art work through out the area shows the different culture and in the garden area you can sit and relax without a care with a glass of wine. The PRICES are EXCELLENT and the owners and staff are most gracious and make you feel like this is home...I have traveled a great deal and my search is over in finding JUNGLA CARIBE... I would suggest it for a solo traveler, couples, moneymooners and children or a group of people.....a place for all.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and location”
Reviews.Author: samspain
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and like other reviews say the steps are quite steep but it didn't spoil it for us .The bedrooms are nicely decorated and the balconies with sea views were great the common areas really are something special with lots of plants and water with tables and chairs an oasis on 5th Avenue!! The plumbing could do with updating (bit smell drains) but I got the impression that there was a lot of work being carried out and that is the reason that the price is so good, I thought it was definately value for money adjacent to some very expensive hotels and I think once the hotel has finished it's refurb it will be ideal.Think they are going to have a bar. Good front desk staff and internet acces in the public areas.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of plants, nice balcony”
Reviews.Author: evilmosquito
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at Jungla Caribe for the first night of our trip to the Yucatan. It was a nice hotel with a good balcony and view of 5th Ave. We paid $63 for the night. The room had A/C and was clean. The hot water in the shower took 5 minutes to get going, but was fine after it was hot. The bed was not comfortable; we could feel the springs in the mattress. The best part about this hotel is the courtyard which is filled with plants. We only stayed one night, but would consider staying there again if the price was lower. There are better values in playa.

Reviews.Title: “reminds me of new orleans french district”
Reviews.Author: crazycabobob
Reviews.Content: Travel light you cannot drive to the hotel because it is located in a no vehicle area. Steep stairs to rooms, be careful. Hotel was under construction ( right under our room). We tried to deal with the noise but it got the best of us so we requested another room. They upgraded us to a VERY nice suite at the back of the hotel but they had to shut the water off for most of the day ( every day). Stayed another day and coudn't deal with it anymore. The hotel gave us a FULL refund when we decided to move to a new location. This was my second stay and If you are a people watcher and like the nightlife and being ONE block from the beach then this is a great place for you to stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you've never been to Playa, this is the perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: TrumpetArtist
Reviews.Content: My profession as an international recording trumpet artist has allowed me to travel to many beautiful and exotic places around the world. My wife, Jance, and I live 7 months of the year in Playa (Nov - Dec) at the Jungla Caribe Hotel. We have all the services of the hotel including maid service, air condition, pool, cable, all kitchen appliances and cookware. At the Jaguar Restaurant, I strongly recommend the Filet mignon on green pepper corn and cognac. Janice loves the grilled jumbo shrimp followed by chocolate mousse dessert. i prefer the Mayan coffee. The owner and all the staff are wonderful people. If you've never been to Playa del Carmen this is the perfect location. "Dois Boutique" (Mayan for "Thank you")

Reviews.Title: “could be much better”
Reviews.Author: carol5580
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located in the main avenue. But it has the restaurant downstairs that connects with the hotel, so people from the restaurant can go upstairs to the floor where the rooms are. The room was big but was full of humidity, there was only a small window in the toilet. We were offered the superior room but was full of humidity as well. The room had a fan on the ceiling. There was a tiny swimmingpool in the middle of the patio mixed with the tables of the restaurant, but was not in use. Wouldn´t go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice basic hotel in the middel of Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: tabascoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel for 5 nights with my girlfriend and we where overall satisfied. The Hotel has a great location in the middle of Playa del Carmen. If you like it quite don't stay here and if you want to stay there i would recommend to book a room without a balcony because that will give you more noise from the street. The room was big and clean but the air-con was so noisy we had to shut it off when we went to bed. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Indoor Jungle Atrium in the middle of 5th!! Fun decor!”
Reviews.Author: bmohlman
Reviews.Content: Hotel Jungla Caribe is located on the corner of 5th and 8th and a ½ block from the beach- in the middle of everything. The hotel ambiance gives sophistication, class, and style! There website CAN be a bit deceiving--- you may think you are getting a budget cost for what they portray in their website photos. However, the budget rooms are more basic than the rooms pictured on the website. With much research, I knew I was staying in a basic room for the budget price and expected budget accommodations. The hotel does offer nicer rooms at a higher price that face 5th avenue although I cannot review those rooms for I didn’t see them. The hotel offers a handful of budget rooms that face 8th street (balcony has a view of the water). At $42 USD a night in May, I got a deal! I’m a backpack, budget traveler and was generally pleased with the room-- which was roomy and had more than the basics. The lobby is colorfully decorated with modern folk art. The inside atrium is filled with tropical plants and gives a jungle feel throughout the hotel. Open the door from inside your hotel room out to the indoor garden filled atrium and feel as though you are in a jungle. Open the door to your balcony and see 5th street, 8th street and a view of the sea! We were located on the 2nd floor, which had no elevator (most small hotels do not), yet the stairs seems a bit slippery from the super gloss paint on the wide stair railings. I was sure to watch my hands in case I lost my step! After reading previous ratings on trip advisor, I was sure to be prepared for the noise, yet the mariachi band I heard only played until around 8:30-9pm and I stayed over a weekend. I did buy earplugs, just in case, but didn’t need them. Noise was not an issue and considering the location, I expected it, but slept great! The room was very clean, had a double bed, attached end tables, a big side table by the door, a cushioned chair and lots and I mean LOTS of storage for luggage- big closet! The room also came equipped with a TV, ceiling fan and A/C, which is rare for budget accommodations as well. The bathroom was roomy and also provided a lot of room for storage. The private balcony is small (most are in Playa)- enough room for a couple people to sit and people watch. The hotel does have a nice restaurant. We did have nightcap glasses of wine one night and found them to be a bit pricey, but excellent service. The hotel does have a small pool, but was under renovation upon our visit. Upon checking out I did experience some confusion – Upon email reservation, I asked them to bill me the total amount of my stay –the full amount via credit card. Come to find out they only “held” the room with the credit card- this was a bit confusing and I was unprepared to pay since I thought it was already paid- so be specific in your reservation and bring copies of emails, confirmations, etc. I had a brief email confirmation from them stating that the reservation was all set- I interpreted that as them taking my request and charging the full amount- this was not the case- lesson learned on my part. Overall, I highly recommend the budget rooms to anyone who appreciates a great bang for the buck. Budget hotels are harder to come by in Playa and this one certainly ranks very high in accommodation expectation at a steal of a price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice in pictures, not so much the reality”
Reviews.Author: VermontTigerlil
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister, and we booked it in advance based on the pictures on the website, which make it look really nice. When we got there, it was clearly much more run down than it looks in pictures and everything smells like bathroom disinfectant, which doesn't quite mask the smell of the bathrooms. There is a pool, but you would never get in this pool; my bathroom towel had a hole in it; etc. We had asked for a room on Calle 8, but the construction was very loud so we asked to be moved. The staff was helpful, and we had a room that was nice and quiet and slept well, so we had a tolerable experience overall. The location of this hotel is good, but it doesn't really make up for the rest.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, too noisy!”
Reviews.Author: mahona73
Reviews.Content: Jungla Caribe is right on the main drag - 5th Avenue. So, there is quite a bit of noise coming from outside. But that was the least of my problems! I found the noise coming from inside the hotel overwhelming. 5:30am I was awoken every morning by the sound of a thousand glass bottles crashing. The employees could be heard yelling, talking, laughing. My room was located next to the maids' closet and they proceeded to sit and chat in the early hours of the morning. Luckily I don't understand Spanish. The bedroom and bathroom were average. My bathroom flooded each time I had a shower. It's location is good in terms of the restaurants, bars and beach, and the price is OK. But if you are looking for peace and quiet, this is not the place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hidden treasure in the middle of 5th Av.”
Reviews.Author: Micoco
Reviews.Content: Are you looking for a budget hotel in Playa? This is it. You can´t get cheaper and nicer (at the same time), than this one..... I run into this hotel when looking for accomodation for 2 nights in Playa. I have looked into 7 different hotels, and checked every possible web site back at home, before finding this one. And I´m so happy I did. The others I looked where quite ugly, smelly tiny rooms, bad taste in decoration, or over my budget. We ended up paying here, 40 bucks for a double room. You can´t get cheaper than that on 5th Av., maybe 35, but I assure you the difference is HUGE. The reception people are great. Helpful at all times. The location is unbeatable. One block from the sea, 2 blocks from where the main nightlife is (12ths St). Although the name of the hotel may let you think "jungle = bugs", I saw no bugs nor insects at all. The room (303) was perfect for us. With a balcony looking onto 8th Street, when you went out you could see the ocean on the side. The room itself was spotless. All in white, with a TV and an excellent air-conditioning. The blankets where also white, and the bathroom was all in white tiles and very clean. Nothing to complain about. The hot water took a while to come out, but just a few minutes. That´s all I can say about the negatives....if waiting a few minutes is a problem...... The hotel even has a pool, that looked very nice although we didn´t try it. The restaurant also looked good, but again, didn´t have time to try it..... I´m posting a few pictures I took, so you can see it. Any questions, don´t hesitate to contact me.... I would definitely go back to this hotel at any time....

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing place!!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelTheWorldMunich
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 weeks in this really awesome hotel! Nice, friendly and clean place. Unique furniture and rooms. Great personnel. If you want to spend a cosy, relaxing vacation, this is the place to stay at! Romantic dinner in the courtyard with delicious mexican food, or just walk to the beach and take a swim in the ocean. Bärbel, thanks for everything! Juli, Munich

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent - cosy, friendly, nice people”
Reviews.Author: MarcoPoloDresden
Reviews.Content: I've spent three weeks in this lovely place! Even though it's on Calle 5, it's a very cozy and laid back place. The interior is just overwhelming with its spectacular garden. If you are hungry, the restaurand "Jaguar" also located in the same place is one of the best choices in PDC. Hotel and restaurant are run by the very friendly german owners, but also the mexican staff are really really nice people. For sure I'll come back. Thanks for everything to Senora Barbara and Don Rolf. All the best from Dresden, Bernd

Reviews.Title: “We Love PDC”
Reviews.Author: diamondjacktraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick getaway (2 nights) to PDC. Jungla Caribe was a quick pick because we booked last minute (The night before we left). The hotel was exactly what you should expect for the money, basic. Our room was clean and the service was great. All the reviews hold some truth, but you have to remember, these rooms are very inexpensive!!! Negatives: Our A/C stopped working every night and the room gets really really hot! Our celing fan was not working either. We never brought it up with management, we were only there two nights so we dealt with it. There are no luxuries, a bed and a bath room. Positives; Staff was friendly (thanks Paulo), and helpful. Restaurant at Hotel was convenient and food choices were plentiful. Location was great, right on fifth ave (our balcony was on the side street, but we had a great view of the nightly crowds). I would not recommend this for anyone traveling with children or looking for comfort.

Reviews.Title: “great deal for the money”
Reviews.Author: swedenole
Reviews.Content: hello, we are swedish couple (so please excuse our english) and just stayed for the second time at the "hotel jungla caribe" in playa del carmen.we are still in mexico travelling around.the first time we visited the "jungla caribe" was in 2003.something we always liked about this place was the location.it really is in the heart of everything.we stayed for one week and noticed right away a lot of changes.we talked to the german owners and they told us that all the changes has been made after the hurricane in 2005.we had a junior suite for a very reasonable price and the room was clean and very spacious.we had no trouble what so ever.we liked that the prices didn't go up after all the effort that put into the remodelation.it may is not a perfect place but it is very charming.the owners made us feel very special.eversince the hotel is located on 5th avenue and has his restaurant open till 11pm you have to expect some minor noice.but that never bothered us.we do not stay on the 5th avenue in order to go to bed at 9pm. the restaurant went through a lot of changes since 2003 as well.we walked around in playa a lot and we realised that there are not that many hotels with a restaurant on side.we liked the fact that we were able to sign the check after breakfast and pay everything at the end of our stay. overall:very charming place at a great location with a lot of personal service for the money. we will stay there again on our way back to sweden. greetings, swedenole

Reviews.Title: “nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: bluebomberfan16
Reviews.Content: Jungla Caribe hotel is a hotel with lots of character to it. The rooms were very clean. The pool area is surrounded with lush tropical vegetation...absolutely beautiful. The pool area is mostly for appearance...I didnt see anyone use this feature of the hotel. Perhaps the best feature to this hotel is the location. The Jungla is parked right on the main pedestrian walkway and no more than half a block away from the beach. The rooms have nice balconys - it was nice to sit out there and feel the energy from the street below. Overall, great experience, I would definatley go back to this hotel in a heartbeat. For the money, its 100% worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you're desperate.”
Reviews.Author: bootsy_darling
Reviews.Content: My partner and I spent one night here out of desperation. We took a day trip over to the mainland from Cozumel to see the mayan ruins of Tulum and Coba. When we returned to Playa later that night we were exhausted and stopped for food before taking what we thought would be the last ferry back at midnight. We were wrong. The last ferry left at 11pm. So we found ourselves stranded on the mainland for the night. We knew of a few good hotels in the area which we had looked at before booking our trip, but they either had no vancancy or cost way too much just to sleep there for a few hours before we caught the first ferry back in the morning. Hotel Jungla Caribe was close to the ferry and seemed cool at first with its funky design. We had great difficulty communicating with the front desk receptionist as we spoke little spanish and he spoke no english. We needed a wake up call at 5:30am and weren't sure he had understood. Surprisingly, we did get a knock on the door on time, but it wasnt expected. As we were being lead to our room, we were put off by some partially eaten room service food that had just been left on the ground out side the door to an adjacent room which nobody had bothered to take away. Our room was rather bare and we had some initial difficulty with the lock. The walls were white and plain. We liked the black and white checkered floor, but the furniture was dilapdated and tacky. The airconditioner didnt work properly and was noisey. The beds were big but a little hard. The bathroom was spacious but dirty. The water never got above lukewarm and we were shivering through our shower just like the other reviewer mentioned. Ample towels were provided however. All in all, I felt safe but slightly uncomfortable. If it weren't for Jungla Caribe we would have probably spent the night on the beach...which might have been more fun in retrospect though not as safe i suppose...However, I wouldn't stay here again unless I was traveling on a tight budget (and its really not even that cheap for what you get) or planned on trashing the room or something. It does seem as thought it could be a lot nicer than it is and its sad that the staff are not maintaining what could be a funky affordable place to stay. We were glad to return to a beautiful Amaranto Suite on Cozumel the next day.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Jungla Caribe
HotelInfo.Address: 5A Avenida y Calle 8, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
